intro: Hibbertia dispar, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia dispar has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its distinctive appearance.
